intro: Rubus arrhenii subsp. polyadenes, commonly known as the red raspberry, is a species of bramble native to North America. It is characterized by its trailing or scrambling growth habit and produces clusters of red, edible berries. The plant features trifoliate leaves with serrated edges and pink to white flowers that bloom in the spring. Its fruit is rich in vitamin C and is widely used in culinary applications. The subspecies is distinguished by its hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its unique botanical appearance.
